intro: Fagara alata var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly fagara, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage, which gives it its common name. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and are arranged alternately along the stems. Fagara alata var. tomentosa produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often followed by orange to red berries.
